snippet: Retirement-age Britons travel to India, where adventures await in the ensemble comedy “The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel.”
abstract: Stephen Holden reviews movie The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel, directed by John Madden; Judi Dench and Bill Nighy star. Photo (M)2
lead_paragraph: ''The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel'' belongs to the ''Enchanted April'' school of agreeable grown-up entertainment, in which transplanted Britons shake off the North Atlantic chill on a life-altering trip to warmer climes. Instead of Italy in the 1920s, the place of renewal is Jaipur, India, and the time is now. Its seven travelers are financially distressed men and women of retirement age lured by an invitation to ''outsource'' themselves for a stay at the newly opened Best Exotic Marigold Hotel in Jaipur. Upon arrival, they discover a place that is far from the luxurious retreat ''for the elderly and beautiful'' that its advertising claims. But after much grumbling, most of them take it in stride and begin to flourish.

headline.main: Seven Tickets to India, Please, and Reservations for an Adventure
